summary: This document contains official correspondence regarding Jeffrey Epstein's travel notification requirements as a registered sex offender in the U.S. Virgin Islands, and a response from Moroccan authorities confirming his travel to Morocco in April 2019. It shows enforcement of travel restrictions and international coordination.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Registered sex offender subject to travel restrictions
persons.context: The primary subject of the travel notification requirements from the Virgin Islands Department of Justice and the subject of the Moroccan border crossing inquiry.

persons.name: Carol Thomas-Jacobs
persons.role: Acting Attorney General of the U.S. Virgin Islands
persons.context: Signed the March 14, 2019 letter to Jeffrey Epstein outlining stricter travel notification requirements.

persons.name: Youssef Chami
persons.role: Director General for National Security, Chief of Cabinet in Charge of General Affairs (Morocco)
persons.context: Signed the Moroccan Ministry of Interior response confirming Jeffrey Epstein's border crossings in Morocco.

connections.description: Thomas-Jacobs, as Acting Attorney General, is the official notifying Epstein of his legal obligations regarding travel as a registered sex offender.
Chami's office conducted a search and provided information to U.S. authorities about Epstein's border crossings in Morocco.

events.title: USVI DOJ issues stricter travel notification letter to Epstein
events.description: The U.S. Virgin Islands Department of Justice sends a letter to Jeffrey Epstein revoking previous provisions and outlining strict new conditions for notifying authorities of any travel outside the territory.

events.title: Epstein's entry and exit from Morocco
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein made border crossings (entry and exit) at Marrakech-Menara airport in Morocco, using passport #566672615.

events.title: Moroccan authorities confirm Epstein's travel
events.description: The Moroccan Ministry of the Interior's General Directorate for National Security responds to a U.S. consular request, confirming Epstein's two border passages in April 2019.

locations: 6100 Red Hook, Suite B3, St. Thomas, VI 00802-1348
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was subject to strict travel notification requirements as a registered sex offender in the U.S. Virgin Islands, requiring 21 days' notice for international travel.
On April 25, 2019, Epstein traveled to and from Morocco via Marrakech-Menara airport.
Moroccan authorities confirmed Epstein's travel to U.S. consular officials in May 2019 in response to an information request.
The U.S. Virgin Islands Department of Justice revoked previous, more lenient travel notification provisions for Epstein in March 2019.
Failure to comply with the Virgin Islands travel reporting requirements could result in prosecution under both territorial and federal law (18 U.S.C. ยง 2250).
